```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
```

## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
mld <- read.csv("~/Desktop/bats_2016_2019/heatmaps/mld/mld_v2.csv", sep=",")
mldfluo <- ggplot(mld, aes(x=orderno, y=Fluo.ug.L., fill=Season)) + geom_bar(stat="identity", position=position_dodge(width=0), width=0.5, fill="dark green") + ylim (0,0.6) + theme_classic()+ geom_col(width = 1)
mldperpras <- ggplot(mld, aes(x=orderno, y=per_pras_euk, fill=Season)) + geom_bar(stat="identity", position=position_dodge(width=0), width=0.5) + ylim (0,100) + theme_classic()+ geom_col(width = 1)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
mldfluo
mldperpras

ggsave("mld_fluo_reclassified.pdf", plot=mldfluo, dpi=300, height=5, width=25)
ggsave("mld_perpras_reclassified.pdf", plot=mldperpras, dpi=300, height=5, width=25)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
